alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 6:36AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Georgia, including the following counties, Columbia and Richmond. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 634 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have already fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Augusta, Evans, Martinez, Augusta, Daniel Field, Augusta Mall, Summerville, Glendale, Midtown, South Augusta, and Forest Hills. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 193 and 200. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
